title: Add Claude Code skills for workday CLI
description:
Add slash command skills to Claude Code for workday CLI integration.

## Skills Created
- `/wd` - Main overview and quick reference
- `/wd-start` - Plan your workday
- `/wd-timer` - Start pomodoro timer
- `/wd-status` - Check current progress
- `/wd-done` - End day with summary
- `/wd-task` - Task management (add/done/list)
- `/wd-pause` - Pause/resume timer
- `/wd-stats` - Overall statistics
- `/wd-history` - Recent history

Located in `.claude/skills/` directory.

title: Add workday duration tracking
description:
Track wall-clock duration from `workday start` to `workday done`.

## Changes Made
- Added `started_at` and `ended_at` fields to Day model
- Added `duration_seconds()` and `duration_formatted()` methods to Day
- Updated database schema with migration for existing DBs
- Updated `workday start` to record start time
- Updated `workday done` to record end time
- Updated day summary to display duration
- Updated history to show duration per day

## Status
Code changes complete, needs testing and commit.

title: Implement Workday CLI MVP
description:
Implement a command-line pomodoro timer for Linux servers with Telegram notifications.

## Completed Features
- Click-based CLI with both `workday` and `wd` commands
- Background daemon timer that survives terminal disconnection
- SQLite storage for days, tasks, pomodoros, and streaks
- Telegram notifications for focus/break transitions
- Signal-based pause/resume using SIGUSR1/SIGUSR2
- Alternating email/rest breaks for balanced recovery
- Day planning with task management
- Progress tracking and statistics

## Commands Implemented
- setup, start, timer, pause, resume, skip, stop
- status, stats, history
- task add/done/list
- done (end of day)
close_reason: MVP implementation complete - all core features working
